_header: Man beware the way is slither
Note: See also 3356; the first stanza is almost identical with stanza 4 of 5891.
Subjects: warnings; carols, satirical; executors, criticism of; satire
_description: Against false executors — four quatrains (aaab) with the refrain: ‘Lytyll ioye ys son done’, and burden: ‘Haue in mynd in mynd in mynd / Secuters be oft onekynd’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Man bewar þe way ys slederþy sowle sall go þou
                    wottes not weder…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…God send vs love & chariteLyttyl joye ys son
                    done
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols printed from a manuscript in the Sloane
                Collection.
         London: Pickering, 1836: 4.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.

            1977: 255-6; 1977, 226.
